intro: Serpocaulon × sessilipinnum, commonly known as the hybrid serpocaulon, is a rare and unique plant species that belongs to the family Restionaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The species is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, coastal environments. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a preference for well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
